entry.title: Projects
entry.summary:
Here is my default project dummy. I will fill this with real projects some time soon.

In many cases you want to publish either results of your work, documentation or specific tool in the web. While there are tons of hosting services, it is quite convenient to start publishing your static pages, e.g. all html, css and javascript is pre-generated. This does not mean that data is required to be static: you can point to the outer source of data (which is the best practice anyway).

Among other advantages of this approach, most useful is that it fully copy with "Continious integration" idea, â€” you can constantly add new features and work on your project, while (either all or selected) commits will be automatically broadcasted.
